title: ‘Knifeman’ who ‘made threats’ in Manchester Nando’s held under Mental Health Act
text:
Armed police and paramedics were rushed to the scene last night (Picture: LNP)

A 26-year-old man has been detained under the Mental Health Act after a major security scare at Manchester’s Arndale Shopping Centre last night.

Armed police were called to the scene shortly before 9pm to reports of a man brandishing a knife.

Members of the public tried to stop the man after he picked up cutlery sets and started making threats at a Nando’s restaurant inside the centre.

It was a week after multiple people were stabbed and injured in a random attack at the very same shopping centre.

Greater Manchester Police said last night’s suspect had been arrested on suspicion of affray and has since been detained under the Mental Health Act.

Officers were also called on Friday last week after a knifeman injured several people (Picture: PA)

A woman suffered a minor injury and was treated at the scene, but no other injuries have been reported, the force said.

On Friday last week, a 40-year-old man spared a terror alert when he allegedly launched an attack on passers-by on the ground floor of the busy shopping centre.

He was later detained under the Mental Health Act after four people were injured.

A 59-year-old man received stab wounds to his hand and palm and a 19-year-old woman sustained wounds to her arm and armpit which required surgery.

Both suspects were detained under the Mental Health Act (Picture: LNP)

Another 19-year-old woman suffered a cut to her elbow, a 33-year-old woman received a cut to her stomach and a 43-year-old woman was assessed by medics but appeared uninjured.

All of the victims have since been discharged from hospital.

Counter-terrorism officers are leading the investigation, although they have confirmed that so far, no political, religious or ideological motivation has been uncovered.

The shopping centre is just a few hundred yards from the Manchester Arena, where 22 people were killed in May 2017 when Salman Abedi detonated a suicide bomb after an Ariana Grande concert.

description: A man who sparked a terror alert at Nando's in the Arndale Centre, Manchester, has been detained under the Mental Health Act.
